Privat Memoriall from M
r
Secret
r
./.

page.lettertext:
fol.285r
158[.]
1589 Belgia
A Memoriall for M
r
Bodeley.
To let the parties under mencioned understande by yo
r
l
re
s the care
hir Ma
tie
hath of them and the speciall charge given
t
unto you to deale
effectually w
th
the states for them, and to pray them to acquainte you
w
th
their greeves & what redresse they desire.
assoone as I
arrive./.
Collonel Shincke
Doctor Aisma Pr
e
of Frise
Deventer
Clare hagen
of
utrecht
Cap
t
Backes
The banished men of
Leyden
.
To conferre w
th
m
r
Gilpin
howe som money may be taken uppe
either there or in
Germany
for hir ma
tie
upon the m
e
chant adventurers
bonde.
100000
li
To learne out very carefully whither the states shalbe hable to continue
their meanes of contribution.
To learne w
ch
aswell of the
states g
n
all
as of the
Counsaill of estate
stande well affected to hir ma
tie
and this realme and who not.
To sounde
Barnevelde
touching S
t
Aldegonde
.
That the worlde doth note a great ingratitude in them to suffer a
man of S
t
Aldegondes desert to lacke & not to be imployed.
That whereas some offers have ben made of some places in the
revolted provinces what the states will do extraordinarily for the
tecting
of the saied places if any such thinge should fall out.
To advertise who of the states g
n
all or of the Counsaill of estate
are men of best judgment.
To learne what townes w
th
in the united provinces are held doubtfull
or unsounde and w
ch
of them are held sounde.
Francis Walsyngham
